translation.note: an arc figure (part of a circle)
an ellipse figure
line figure
Point figure (just a dot)
Polygon figure
rectangle figure
conditional figure
Image figure
text figure
label with the input on the left side.
label with the input on the right side.
The name shown to add a wire
unique name for each object
Whether or not a label is an input vs an output
This is a header for the field to edit a label's text
Header for figure foreground color
Header for figure background color
Header for whether or not a figure has a transparent background color
Header for text font
Header for text font size
Header for text font style
Header for normal text direction ( horizontal )
Header for vertical text direction
Header for text direction that is ascending ( climbing from left to right )
Header for text direction that is descending ( going down from left to right )
Text for undo/redo when a single label is renamed. Note: The dual single quotes below must be preserved.
Text for undo/redo when multiple labels are renamed. Note: The dual single quotes below must be preserved.
Undo list message for setting the color values of selected figures
The name of a new control program that has not been saved yet. [Untitled X].
short description of a single microblock. The first parameter is for the short name. The second is the type. There's nothing here to translate.
Short description of a single label. The first argument is the name. The second is whether or not its an input or an output
Short description of a wire. The argument is the type (analog or binary).
Description shown for undo/redo when a symbol is imported.
Description shown for undo/redo when something is pasted.
Description shown for undo/redo when a favorite something is inserted.
Short description of a receptacle. This version includes input/ouput, the type, the name, and its index
Short description of a receptacle. This version includes input/ouput, the type, (NO NAME) and its index
description of something that is an input vs an output.
description of something that is an output vs an input.
The name of the default value set. It cannot be renamed (by the user) and must always exist. This is basically the baseline values that must always be present.
status message notifying the user that the symbol was successfully saved and where it was saved.
status message notifying the user that the control was successfully saved and where it was saved.
status message notifying the user that the control program was successfully compiled to an equipment file and where it was saved.
This is for a microblock that we read in and do not know what type it is. This is for forward compatibility so current versions can at least open files created by future version of the application.
message that 1 item has been added.
"added x items." message for when multiple (or no) items have been added (just not 1). where x is the number of items added.
"Delete point (x,y)" where x and y are the coordinates of the point deleted.
"Deleted x items." where x is the number of items deleted. This is for deleting multiple or no items (just not 1).
"message that mulitple things were moved
"message that a microblock was moved
"message that a label was moved
"message that a figure was moved
"message that a wire was moved
"New point (x,y)." message that a new point was created at x,y coordinates.

translation.variant: The code is on the clipboard.
The reference name ''{0}'' is too long. Reference names can only be {1} characters long.
The reference name ''{0}'' is used multiple times. Reference names must be unique.
The duration ''{0}'' is not valid. Durations can only contain number digits.
A reference name cannot begin with a number.
A reference name can contain only letters, digits and underscores and cannot begin with a number.
The reference name ''{0}'' is reserved and cannot be used.
This microblock is not allowed in a control program with this equipment classification.
Microblock [{0}] is not allowed for this equipment classification.
One or more parameters are not properly closed.
An unknown internal compile error occurred. This file will not be attachable in SiteBuilder.

translation.note: Generic error message when a file is not valid.

translation.variant: This equipment was generated by a gateway device and is currently not supported.
Failed to create file. File could not be saved.
An unknown error occurred while trying to write the file.

translation.note: this is for a list of images but the user can chose nothing. If they do, we display [none specified]

translation.variant: Failed to read in microblock's location. Reference Name: {0} ( type: {1} )
Failed to read in unknown microblock type ( {0} ) {1}
Failed to load an unknown resource
Failed to read in unknown microblock ( {0} )
Failed to read in an object.
Save failed. See {0} for more information.
{0} is not a valid file. (Cannot determine file type)

translation.note: error message when we can't determine what type of file this is so we can't read it in.

translation.variant: An error occurred while trying to write out an error file. No error file was generated
There may be too many MBs of type ''{0}'' ( {1} )
The value must be between {0} and {1}
{0} is not a valid real number.
{0} is not a valid unsigned integer.

translation.note: Error that will say 'failed to read location of [input/output label] [name].
Generic error meaning the user tried to open a file that doesn't exist. It will be followed by a newline and the file pathInstance.

translation.variant: This is not a valid value. This should be either 'true' or 'false'.
This is not a valid value. This should be either '1' or '0'.

translation.note: Generic error meaning the user tried to simulate a control program and an unspecified error occurred.

translation.variant: {0} is not a valid template value. Valid characters are letters, numbers, or underscore '_'. Template names must start with a letter.

translation.note: the name field on the edit order list. Shows the name of the microblock. This is not editable.
the description field on the edit order list. Shows the description of the microblock (if it has one). This is not editable.
the reference name field on the edit order list. Shows the reference name of the microblock. This is not editable.
the property page text field on the edit order list. Shows the property page text of the microblock if is has a field (may be blank). This is not editable.
Label for OCL programming language text.
Label for active text.
Label for inactive text.
Label abbreviation for Name Override
Error message that occurs when an image fails to load
Error message to notify the user that embedded images are not supported.
translation.variant: This file contains embedded images which are not supported in this version.

translation.note: Error message to notify that the property for the supplied path wasn't found.
Heading for dialog to notify the user that their document is printing.
Error message thrown when a signed file fails validation.
translation.variant: The file is not valid. It's signature is invalid.

translation.note: Error message thrown when a signed file has missing signatures.
translation.variant: This file is not valid. Its signatures is missing.

translation.note: Error thrown when the simulator detects an error during run time.
translation.variant: An unrecoverable error has occured during the simulation.

translation.note: Tooltip that appears when the cursor hovers over the button to run the simulation.
translation.variant: Runs the simulation using preset time intervals.

translation.note: Tooltip that appears when the cursor hovers over the button to step the simulation through one execution cycle.
translation.variant: Steps the simulation through a single execution cycle.

translation.note: Tooltip that appears when the cursor hovers over the button to stop a running simulation.
Warning to the user informing them why a file name they selected (when they tried to save a control program) is empty and thus illegal. They didn't really pick a name.
Warning to the user informing them why a file name they selected (when they tried to save a control program) is too long and thus illegal.
Warning to the user informing them why a file name they selected (when they tried to save a control program) is invalid.
translation.variant: File names can only contain alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores ( no spaces ) and they cannot start with a number.

translation.note: File description for plugins that only shows up in the file chooser dialog.
Error message for failing to convert a property from one type to another ( i.e. from bit '0','1' to boolean 'true','false' )
Generic error message where the problem is not known.
Error message that occurs when the conversion table is out of sync with the definitions.
translation.variant: Internal error. Definition may be out of synch with conversion information.

translation.note: Error message generated when we try to read in a property that is undefined.
translation.variant: Failed to read unknown property for {0} ( {1} )

translation.note: Error message generated if we try to fill a figure with an unknown fill pattern.
Error message generated when an unknown font name if found.
translation.variant: No font exists with the name {0}

translation.note: Error message generated when a bad color is found
Error message generated when a bad font stle is found
Error message generated when an illegal font size for a font is found.
translation.variant: {0} is not a valid font size for this font

translation.note: Error message generated when an illegal line type is found.
Message generated whenever the background transparency is modified.
Message generated when an invalid wire type is found.
Message seen in undo list that shows a microblock property has changed values.
Error message generated when we save the source, but could not compile it during the save.
translation.variant: Internal Error. Failed to build equipment. The source file is NOT corrupt unless other errors occur.

translation.note: Error message generated when we read in a file but can't find the file version information
Error message generated when we try to read in a property that is undefined.
Error message generated when we try to read in properties and they could not be read correctly.
translation.variant: The following properties were not read in correctly {0}: {1}

translation.note: Error message generated when the user ( or program ) tries to place a microblock in an illegal location.
translation.variant: Probable cause: {0} doesn't allow Microblocks on top of other microblocks or wire/label endpoints. EIKON for WebCTRL allowed this, but this sometimes lead to inadvertantly hiding a connection making locating problems difficult and sometimes lead to unexpected behavior. Press the Correct button to place it again.

translation.note: Message displayed when an error has been fixed
This is a partial message generated when an attempt is made to set a property to an illegal value.
This is a partial message generated when an attempt is made to set a property to an illegal value.
Message displayed for a search and replace.
Message displayed when a wire changes type, for example from analog to binary.
Error message for a bad property value. Not really meant for the end user to see.
Error message for an OCL microblock that has had too many inputs created.
translation.variant: Too many inputs defined. 16 is the maximum number of allowed inputs.

translation.note: Error message for an OCL microblock used in ZN classification that was not tagged.
translation.variant: An OCL microblock used in a ZN control program must be tagged.

translation.note: Error message for an invalid character in a label.
translation.variant: '{0}' at index {1} is not a valid character for labels.

translation.note: Message displayed when a bad time value is found. It either has illegal characters or an incorrect format.
Message displayed when an error has no detailed information to display.
translation.variant: There are no details for this error.

translation.note: Message for an option to show typical or common properties on graphics.
translation.variant: Show properties typically shown on graphics.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but having more microblocks than are allowed. It says what the max is and how many you've exceeded it by some amount. It also points out that not all types of microblocks are included in the count.
translation.variant: A ZN control program can have a maximum of {0} microblocks (excluding labels, text, status microblocks, and I/O microblocks inside of custom microblocks). This control program exceeds the maximum by {1} microblocks.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but having a microblocks that is not allowed.
translation.variant: Microblock {0} is not allowed in ZN equipment.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but not having the required microblocks.
translation.variant: Missing required microblocks for ZN. ZN requires a BACnet time clock, a setpoint and either a Logistat or RS Zone Sensor, or an input named 'zone temp'.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but having too many PID microblocks.
translation.variant: Too many PID loop microblocks. ZN modules can only contain {0}

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but having too many Set Color.
translation.variant: Too many Set Color microblocks. ZN modules can only contain {0}

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but having microblocks outside the allowed bounds.
translation.variant: Required microblocks must be between ({0}, {1}) and ({2}, {3}) bounds for ZN.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but not having the required microblocks.
translation.variant: Missing required input for the setpoint. The setpoint's 'zone' input must be either an analog input, analog network input, Logistat zone sensor, RS zone sensor (with or without fan control) or a label named 'zone temp'. If the input comes from the Logistat it must be tied to the 'zone temp' output. If the input comes from an RS or RSF sensor it must be tied to the 'zone' output.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for ZN, but not having the required microblocks.
translation.variant: Missing required microblock(s) for UNI. UNI requires a BACnet time clock and a setpoint.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for UNI, but having a microblocks that is not allowed.
translation.variant: Microblock {0} is not allowed in UNI equipment.

translation.note: Error message displayed when trying to compile the control program for UNI, but having a microblocks that is not allowed.
translation.variant: All {0} microblocks must connect to the setpoint''s {1} output for UNI.

translation.note: Error message displayed when an image could not be loaded because the image file wasn't found.
translation.variant: ''{0}'' could not be read because the image is either missing or corrupted.

translation.note: Default label name for a new label.
Label when general comments when present (and optional) for something in a list. The item will be displayed. If it has comments, this text will be shown followed by the comments.
Error messages stating that a specific microblock has at least 1 property that is in error.
Description of image files in the 'file type' combo box of a file chooser dialog
This is displayed if the user adds or renames a Program Defaults (value set) name so its blank (or just whitespace).
translation.variant: Program Default names cannot be blank.

translation.note: This is displayed if the user adds or renames a Program Defaults (value set) name that has too many characters. The parameter here is for the maximum number of characters
translation.variant: Program Default names can only be {0} characters max.

translation.note: This is displayed if the user tries to open a file containing (or other operations using) an unsupported microblocks.
General error message for a control program that is not supported in this version/brand of LogicBuilder.

These are details to an error. It specifies that the control program that was attempted to be opened contains multiple 'program defaults'. This features is not supported in this version/brand of LogicBuilder -- which doesn't even present the user with the feature.
translation.variant: This contains multiple program defaults. This feature is not supported.

translation.note: This is the description for files that are created by the Third Party BACnet Utility. This shows up in File dialogs when a user tries to select a file.

This is the description for files that contain information about BACnet objects. This file is generated by WebCTRL and imported by the Third Party BACnet Utility. This shows up in File dialogs when a user tries to select a file.
